channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #150 - Hot? Cold? Exotic? Urban? Don't Worry: We Have a Conference For You
item.description: If you are looking for conferences to attend, this week's edition of the Perl Weekly will make you very happy indeed. In addition of reports of conferences that just ended (and will be back next year), we have announcements for quite a few conferences and workshops happening this summer and fall: Florida, Switzerland, Grenada, Austria, the buffet is as varied as it is appetizing. ~ Yanick
item.dc:subject: list of tags?

item.title: We are Hiring a Senior Perl Software Developer - Grant Street Group
item.description: We are a growing software company using open source software/modern Perl practices to build innovative e-payment, auction, and tax collection web applications. We are looking for talented, motivated professionals committed to flawless work and customer service.

item.title: chromatic, author of Modern Perl
item.description: chromatic is the author of Modern Perl, a book that for the last few years fills the niche of presenting Perl via the lense of its modern best practices. The electronic versions of the book (pdf, ePub, mobi) are available for free, and the raw source of the book itself is available on GitHub.

item.title: Modern Perl: 2014 Electronic Editions Released
item.description: It's modern, and now available as a ePub and mobi eBooks.

item.title: Announcing the Austrian Perl Workshop 2014
item.description: Not anything planned for this October? How about visiting the beautiful city of Salzburg, and attend the Austrian Perl Workshop?

item.title: Swiss Perl Workshop has ROOM
item.description: Hunting for conferences that are not in exotic, incredibly warm places? The Swiss Perl Workshop now has rented its locale.

item.title: II Does Training
item.description: Infinity Interactive's list of YAPC::NA courses. Yes, there is still time to register for these!

item.title: GitPrep 1.8 is released - Public key authentication support
item.description: Yuki Kimoto releases a new version of GitPrep, the Perl-based GitHub-like repository service.

item.title: Granada Perl Workshop
item.description: Hankering for conferences in exotic locations? The Granada Perl Workshop is going to take place on Friday, June the 27th, Salvador Fandino reminds us.

item.title: YAPC::NA - Getting Ready to Travel
item.description: Only a handful of weeks until YAPC::NA, and Khaos is slowly preparing herself to take the road for the event.

item.title: What I learned in college because I had to use mainframes
item.description: As a follow-up to Andy Lester's article of last week, Joe McMahon reminesces about the days where computers's weight (in tons) and storage capacity (in megs) were roughly equivalent, and how that wildly different paradigm shaped his skills.

item.title: One year of Perl Maven Pro
item.description: Gabor has reasons to celebrate: Maven Pro is now one year old!

item.title: Perl in a Developing Country
item.description: This entry is the first of a series, where Kasek Galgal plans to explore the role and potential of Perl in developing countries.

item.title: The Often Overlooked Perl Module Pod::Usage
item.description: by Michael Gerb.

item.title: Removing Perl Boilerplate with Import::Into
item.description: Perl 5.20 gives us a few more shiny tools to play with, but enabling them usually requires a line or two more of boilerplate code at the top of your files. Mike Friedman wants the former very much, but isn't too keen on the latter.

item.title: List::Util additions in Perl 5.20
item.description: List::Util and List::MoreUtils are a cornucopia of useful functions. LeoNerd tells us about the latest changes that come to them for, and in the wake of, the 5.20.0 release.

item.title: Cleaning up your DarkPAN
item.description: Steven Haryanto shares a few more tools useful for the scrubbing and clean-up the old releases of one's CPAN account.

item.title: Etsy's skyline port to perl
item.description: The original skyline uses Python's numpy and scipy. Here we have a port of its algorithms in Perl's own PDL.

item.title: Logging Apple Battery Data with Perl
item.description: Owner of an Apple laptop and want to query and graph your battery usage? mikegrb has a script for you.

item.title: playing with Cairo
item.description: Dmitry Karasik is porting a First-Person engine in Perl using Cairo. Good news, the coding was smooth sailing. Bad news, performance is not quite the zippiest.

item.title: Dancer & DBIx::Class
item.description: Stefan Hornburg (Racke) talks about Dancer and DBIx::Class. (35 min)

item.title: CSV Less complicated
item.description: In direct from NLPW::2014, Merijin Band (Tux) presents "CSV Less complicated". (40 min)

item.title: Clashes of slashes or the division of dividers
item.description: Theo van Hoesel talks about math and how he extended Number::Fraction. (20 min)

item.title: How the Camel is de-cocooning
item.description: Elizabeth Mattijsen (liz) comparing Perl 5 and Perl 6 syntax. (40 min)

item.title: Parsing NaN in JSON - JavaScript and Perl
item.description: Why Perl could not parse the JSON file created by a Python script?

item.title: Perl-related events
item.description: In the following cities: Paris (FR), St. Petersburg (Ru), Orlando (FL/USA), Granada (ES), Sofia (BG), Tokyo (JP), FlÃ¶rli Olten (CH), Salzburg (AT)
